page.title: 09Shopping habits
page.content: The{shopping habits}of the villagers are investigated in order to understand their importance to the area. Goods chosen were bread and furniture.{BREAD:}people tended to go to the nearest place as each village had at least one bread shop. This was for freshness and convenience. Other larger towns eg. Huddersfield, Wakefield and Barnsley also influenced the purchasing of bread because of competitive prices, specialist shops and convenience of multi-purpose shopping.{FURNITURE:}these goods are not required as often and are thus obtained further afield because variety, price and reputation of suppliers are more important than convenience when spending a lot of money. Leeds and Manchester compete for custom. Delivery areas also influence the range of these goods.
